page.title: 02Villages 1 - Wernrhyeolydd
page.content: Wernrhyeolydd This is a small village with a population of 30. There are no buses so the villagers are dependent on their own transport. A school bus pichs up children every day to take them to Raglan junior school. There is a pond near the end of the village, fed by a natural spring. The village is a linear settlement. One couple owns 7 acres of land and use some of it as a certificated camping site. They also have a goat, 2 horses and 2 dogs. In a neighbouring house an alderly retired lady helps the "Disposal and Welfare of Horses" organisation. This organisation helps to find good homes for old or mal-treated horses. All the villagers live locally or in Abergavenny.
